Key Match Events: The New Orleans Pelicans defeated the Chicago Bulls, 123-111, with Brandon Ingram leading the way with 33 points and C.J. McCollum adding 23.
Pre-Game Insights: Bulls coach Billy Donovan noted that Lonzo Ball would be limited to 14-16 minutes of playing time as the team continues to monitor his recovery.
Post-Match Reflections: The guard's comeback story was nothing short of impressive, considering the career-threatening injuries he faced.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lonzo Ball played 13 minutes and 39 seconds, tallying five points and four assists in his return to regular-season action for the first time since January 2022.
Others: LaVar Ball blames NBA conditioning regime for Lonzo Ball's injury
The Bulls traded Alex Caruso for young guard Josh Giddey from the OKC Thunder
